thread.title: Prep Roundup: Pope rallies from two-set hole in first round
thread.title_full: Prep Roundup: Pope rallies from two-set hole in first round

author: MDJ staff reports (noreply@mdjonline.com)
title: Prep Roundup: Pope rallies from two-set hole in first round
text: Prep Roundup: Pope rallies from two-set hole in first round by MDJ staff reports The Marietta Daily Journal October 16, 2015 01:23 AM | 2 views | 0 | 0 | | Pope rallied from two sets down to stun Grayson 23-25, 23-25, 27-25, 25-23, 17-15 on Thursday in the first round of the Class state playoffs.In the Lady Greyhounds’ second match-point attempt of the fifth set, Sarah Esposito and Meg Krussell combined for the block to score the winning point. Pope led 10-5 in the fifth set before Grayson rallied to tie it at 11-all. Esposito led the Lady Greyhounds with 24 kills, while Danielle Bissel had nine kills and 1½ blocks. Meg Krussel finished with seven kills and led with 3½ blocks.Morgan Dees had 52 assists, 12 digs and two aces. Samantha Walters led the team with 19 digs, and Molly Armitage had 12. Pope will play at South Forsyth in the second round Tuesday. ► Lassiter 3, Archer 0: The Lady Trojans breezed through the first round of the Class state playoffs, winning 25-13, 25-12, 25-10.The win set Lassiter (29-8) up for an all-county second-round match Tuesday at Area 4 champion Harrison.Libby Bochniak led the Area 5 runner-up Lady Trojans with 16 kills and three aces, while Ella Muetterties had six kills and Niah Bruce five to go along with two blocks.Kate Gordon helped fuel the offense with 24 assists.► Harrison 3, Alpharetta 1: After losing a tight first set, the Lady Hoyas rebounded to win 25-27, 25-20, 25-22, 25-23.Katie Doering and Kaylee Morris led the Harrison offense, with Cam Bihary manning the defense.► Mount Paran Christian 3, Tallulah Falls 0: Mount Paran reached the second round of the Class A state playoffs for the third year in a row following a 25-20, 25-18, 25-14 win at home.Sarah Ramstack had a double-double with 12 kills and 14 digs, while Jillian Tucker dished out 34 assists and six kills. Sarah-Hayes Farley added three aces to her 12-kill, 13-dig double-double effort. Sara Armstrong contributed 12 digs and four aces.Mount Paran (22-13) will host either First Presbyterian Day or Savannah Christian in the second round Tuesday.► Trinity Baptist 3, Dominion Christian 0: Hailey Giles and Lucy Niverson each had nine digs, but the Lady Knights lost 25-4, 25-11, 25-16.SOFTBALL► Lee County 7, North Cobb 6: North Cobb held a 6-3 lead into the bottom of the sixth, but Region 1 champion Lee County rallied for four runs and held on to take the decisive third game of the first-round Class state playoff series.The Lady Warriors (16-16), who had 14 hits but also four errors, scored two in the first inning and three in the second to stay ahead of the Lady Trojans, who plated a run in the second and two in the third.North Cobb added a run in the top of the sixth before Lee County’s rally.Iman Muhammad batted 4-for-4 with an RBI and two runs scored, while Emily Kiser was 2-for-2 with an RBI. McKenzie Krause hit a two-run first-inning home run, Jasmine Copeland batted 2-for-4 with a double and Hannah Ross went 3-for-4 with an RBI and a run scored. Cassidy Babcock had a single and an RBI.
